content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────
### Extraction System at Position(-3.5, 27.5)
Consists of:
– Extraction system burner inserter at Position(-3.5, 27.5) (drop position: Position(-3.5, 28.5))
Purpose: To extract raw materials and feed them into the transport network.

### Copper Cable Factory at Position(2.5, 17.5)
Consists of:
– Cable factory input chest at Position(2.5, 17.5)
– Factory burner inserter at Position(2.5, 16.5)
– Dedicated burner inserter (using direction RIGHT) at Position(3.5, 17.5)
– Assembling machine (copper cable production) at Position(1.5, 19.5)
Purpose: To receive extracted materials and process them into copper cables.

### Belt Depot at Position(3.5, 15.5)
Consists of:
– Wooden chest (serving as belt depot) at Position(3.5, 15.5)
– Adjacent transport belt segment at Position(4.5, 15.5)
– Depot burner inserter (using direction UP) at Position(3.5, 14.5)
Purpose: To act as an intermediary drop point in the belt network, ensuring that extraction outputs are properly received without misinterpretation as a steam engine target.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• For transport belt connections:
  – When connecting transport belts, ensure the target is a valid inserter (or similar receiver) rather than a Prototype.SteamEngine. Insert the appropriate intermediary inserter to avoid the “cannot be connected directly” error. (Reported in Steps 210, 211, 213, 214, 215, 216, and 217)

• For entity placement:
  – Verify that the player is within the maximum allowed placement distance before attempting to place an entity (e.g. the wooden chest at (3.5, 15.5) must be placed within range). This avoids “target position is too far” errors.

• Inventory management:
  – Confirm that the necessary item exists in the inventory before placement; a “No wooden_chest in inventory” error indicates the need to check supplies prior to placement. 

• Variable definition:
  – Ensure all variables (such as target_chest) are properly defined and referenced to prevent NameErrors.
